text: Most brokerages have maintained their stock rating on Bharat Heavy Electricals Ltd. (BHEL), after the company reported lower-than-expected first quarter earnings due to higher taxes and other expenses.The company’s net profit increased 3.9 percent to Rs 80.8 crore during the quarter ended June, according to its stock exchange filing. missing the Rs 120 crore average estimate of analysts tracked by Bloomberg.Here’s what brokerage had to say on BHEL post Q1 earnings:
title: What Brokerages Make Of BHEL Q1 Performance
